isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (355.6 MM) STAMPED ANGLE-SPRING CLUTCH - TWO PLATE CLUTCH INSTALLATION

step1.para: Replace pilot bearing. Bearing must have a press fit ( Figure 34).

caution.para: To prevent damage, install by tapping on O.D. of pilot bearing.

step1.para: Install two guide studs 3/8" x 16 thread, 3" long at the top of the flywheel ( Figure 35).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Replace Pilot Bearing - Two Plate
Figure 35. Install Guide Studs - Two Plate

step1.para: Insert the aligning tool and place the front disc in the engine housing with the side marked FLYWHEEL SIDE to the flywheel ( Figure 36).

Install the strap drive intermediate plate over the guide studs. The four holes at the drive straps are the pilot holes for the adapter ring. Make sure the side marked FLYWHEEL SIDE faces the flywheel. Drive straps must face Pressure Plate. Raise the front disc to fit into the intermediate plate opening ( Figure 37).
Install the rear disc by inserting the aligning tool through both splines and into the pilot bearing. Make sure that the disc marked PRESSURE PLATE SIDE faces the pressure plate ( Figure 38).

New Stacked Buttons: When installing this rear disc, make sure the ceramic buttons of the discs are stacked/aligned so that they roughly cover each other when sandwiching the intermediate plate. This will aid the pin separator function.

figure.caption: Figure 37. Raise Front Disc to Fit into Intermediate Plate Opening
Figure 38. Insert Aligning Tool Through Both Splines and Pilot Bearing

step1.para: With the aligning tool still in place, carefully slide the clutch assembly over the aligning tool. Align the lock strap or self-adjuster with the access hole in the bell housing.
Slide the clutch assembly over the guide studs and against the spacer ring ( Figure 39).

Start six 3/8" x 2 1/4" Grade 5 or better mounting bolts and lockwashers and hand tighten. Replace the two guide studs with two capscrews. Tighten the capscrews to 35 to 40 ft-lbs. (47.45 to 54.23 N•m) according to the sequence shown ( Figure 40).
Remove the two wooden blocks from between the release bearing housing and flywheel ring ( Figure 41).

figure.caption: Figure 39. Slide Clutch Assembly Over Guide Studs
Figure 40. Tighten Capscrews According to Sequence Shown
Figure 41. Remove Wooden Blocks From Between Release Bearing Housing and Flywheel Ring
